name: Viticulture
premise: Players participate in the strategic cultivation and trade of wine.
description: Viticulture is a worker-placement game set in the foothills of Tuscany. The players are in the roles of people in rustic, pre-modern Tuscany who have inherited meager vineyards. They have a few plots of land, an old crush pad, a tiny cellar, and three workers.
session_playtime_notes: Playtime varies based on the number of players.
immersiveness_level_notes: Players must strategically manage their vineyard and resources to succeed.
learning_curve_notes: Several strategies can lead to victory, and learning how to best utilize the workers adds depth to the game.
save_mechanism_notes: The game is typically played in a single session without need for a save mechanism.
how_to_win: The player with the most victory points, earned by making and selling wine, wins.
how_to_lose: You might be left behind if other players are more efficient in managing their vineyard and producing wine.
expansions: Viticulture: Visit from the Rhine Valley

reasons: Offers many strategic paths to victory
Interaction with other players in the market

unique_selling_point: Its blend of economic strategy and thematic immersion in the world of wine-making.
